text: West Creek Township is one of eleven townships in Lake County, Indiana. When counted at 2020, its population was 7,676 people and it had 3,046 houses. ==History== West Creek Township was founded in 1839. It took its name from the westernmost of the three nearby large streams. ==Geography== According to the 2020 census, the township has a total area of , of which (or 99.81%) is land and (or 0.19%) is water. ==References== Category:Townships in Indiana
title: West Creek Township, Lake County, Indiana
